author: chris2_2_2
content:
<@602753420033785856> just curious, does that mean if difficulty bomb is going off and increasing block times there will be this same issue?

Just trying to understand how things work I know pos has set times which I thought was 12 seconds so I’m wondering why you said it’s a pow issue.

author: sproul
content: the Ropsten block time is currently determined by the PoW difficulty, and because Ropsten is such a small network (relative to mainnet) that fluctuates all over the place

author: sproul
content: you're right that a similar issue could arise if the difficulty bomb goes off

author: sproul
content: which is why it's good we're testing and honing our eth1 voting now on Ropsten

author: sproul
content: Lighthouse is going to get a configurable parameter that lets you follow the eth1 chain at whatever distance you like, if PoW block times go through the roof then you can follow at a much closer distance (in terms of block number) in order to ensure you see everything within the period from -16h to -8h (the PoW blocks you're meant to be voting on)

author: sproul
content: once the merge occurs, then the block time becomes more or less fixed at the 12s slot time, assuming minimal skipped slots
